definition: playmate
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
variant of 玩[wan2]/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
partner/companion/comrade/associate/to accompany

sentences.english: Guys want a playmate; they don’t want to talk.
sentences.chinese: 男人们都想要个玩伴，他们不喜欢谈话。

sentences.english: He was my playmate in childhood.
Except Billie Wiggins, with whom I never associated.
sentences.chinese: 这群玩伴中不包括比利威金斯，我从来不联系他。

sentences.english: But the tour soon, playmates were Weiwei suddenly discovered missing.
sentences.chinese: 但游了不一会儿，玩伴们突然发现伟伟不见了。

sentences.english: It was uncertain whether my playmates would come(or not).
sentences.chinese: 我的玩伴们是否会来还不肯定。

sentences.english: Pluto was our favorite pet and playmate.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁托是我们最喜欢的宠物和玩伴。

sentences.english: When I was in kindergarten, I was very popular with my playmates because of my naughtiness.
sentences.chinese: 在前边幼儿园，我很受欢迎同我的玩伴因为我的顽皮。

sentences.english: The boy chased his playmate around the block.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩绕着街区追逐他的玩伴。

sentences.english: Susie always gravitates towards the older children in her playgroup .
sentences.chinese: 苏西总是被她玩伴圈子里年纪较大的孩子所吸引。

sentences.english: In the movie, the two playmates follow different paths after school.
sentences.chinese: 影片中，两位玩伴在毕业后走上了不同的道路。

sentences.english: And the 37-inch high horse is more than happy to help her playmate.
sentences.chinese: 而37英寸高的小马戴西也非常乐意帮助自己的玩伴。

definition: good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
best friends/inseparable sidekick/diehard followers
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
younger male cousin via female line
inseparable (as form and shadow)
lit. green plums and hobby-horse (idiom)/fig. innocent children's games/childhood sweethearts/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
intimate friend/close friend
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to accompany
to accompany/to keep sb company
to play around/to disport oneself
to keep sb company/to accompany
erhua variant of 鐵哥們|铁哥们[tie3 ge1 men5]
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
